questiontext.text:
Exercise

Write out the terms of the Fourier series for the periodic signal given by \[ f(t) = \begin{cases} 1 \hspace{1cm} 0 < t < \dfrac{\pi}{2} \\ 0 \hspace{1cm} \dfrac{\pi}{2} < t < 2\pi \end{cases} \] \[ f(t + 2\pi) = f(t).\] You should give the constant term \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) and each term corresponding to \( n = 1\) to \( n = 6\):

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Since \(T = 2\pi\) and since the function has a non-zero average value, the form of the Fourier series is \[ \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{n=1}^\infty \left\{ a_n \cos (n t) + b_n \sin (n t) \right\} \] where \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^{2\pi} }f(t) \cos (n t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 0, 1, 2, \dots \\ b_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^{2\pi} } f(t) \sin (n t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 2, \dots \end{align} \] Because the function is non-negative there will be a constant term. The constant term will be \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) where \( a_0 = \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{2\pi}} f(t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt = \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2} } } dt = \dfrac{1}{2} \).

For \(n = 1, 2, 3, \dots , \) we have \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}}} \cos (nt) \hspace{0.15cm} dt = \dfrac{1}{\pi} \left[ \dfrac{1}{n} \sin (nt) \right] _0^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \\ &= \dfrac{1}{n\pi} \sin \left( \dfrac{n\pi}{2} \right) \\ &= \begin{cases} \dfrac{1}{n\pi}(-1)^{n+1} \hspace{1cm} n = 1,3,5,7, \dots \\ 0 \hspace{2cm} n = 2,4,6,8, \dots \end{cases} \end{align} \] Similarly for \(b_n\) we have \[ b_n = \begin{cases} \dfrac{1}{n\pi} \hspace{1cm} n = 1,3,5, \dots\\ \dfrac{2}{n\pi} \hspace{1cm} n = 2, 6, 10, \dots\\ 0 \hspace{1.2cm} n = 4, 8, 12, \dots \end{cases} \]

Thus the series is given by \[ \begin{align} f(t) &= \dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{\pi} \cos t - \dfrac{1}{3\pi} \cos 3t + \dfrac{1}{5\pi} \cos 5t + \dots \\ &+ \dfrac{1}{\pi} \sin t + \dfrac{2}{2\pi} \sin 2t + \dfrac{1}{3\pi} \sin 3t + \dfrac{1}{5\pi} \sin 5t + \dfrac{2}{6\pi}\sin 6t + \dots \end{align} \]
